knowledge_base.description: Comprehensive knowledge base extracted from AWS Well-Architected Tool workshop covering tool walkthrough, programmatic access, profiles, lenses, and integrations

workshop_overview.title: AWS Well-Architected Tool Workshop
workshop_overview.purpose: Walk through the functionalities of the AWS Well-Architected Tool, guiding you through the process of creating a workload, understanding the foundational pillars, and applying industry-leading best practices
workshop_overview.cost: Free - no costs for this lab
goals: Become familiar with the AWS Well-Architected Tool service
Learn where resources about the questions and best practices are located
Learn how to use milestones to track progress against high and medium risks over time
Learn how to generate a report or view the results of the review in the AWS Well-Architected Tool
Learn how to use the Profiles feature to tailor WAFRs to organization priorities
Learn how to use the Review templates feature to facilitate scalable, pre-filled responses

prerequisites.description: An AWS Account that you are able to use for testing, that is not used for production
IAM user or role with WellArchitectedConsoleFullAccess managed policy

workload_concept.definition: A workload identifies a set of components that deliver business value. The workload is usually the level of detail that business and technology leaders communicate about.
workload_concept.scope: Well-Architected Reviews are conducted per workload

steps.action: Click the 'Define Workload' button on the landing page
On the Define Workload interface, enter the required information

required_fields.example: This is an example for the AWS Workshop

required_fields.description: Select AWS Regions where workload operates

trusted_advisor_integration.description: Integration with AWS Trusted Advisor for accelerated reviews

additional_steps.note: Skip adding tags if not needed
Can skip adding profile at this stage or apply an existing profile

performing_reviews.overview: Reviews are conducted by answering questions across the six Well-Architected Framework pillars

steps.action: From the workload detail page, click 'Start reviewing' button
Select the 'AWS Well-Architected Framework' lens to review
Collapse/expand pillars as needed using the collapsing/expanding icon
Select individual questions (e.g., REL 1. How do you manage service quotas and constraints?)
Answer questions using the Info links for context and guidance
Click 'Next' button at the bottom to proceed to next question
Select 'Save and exit' when ready to pause review

reliability_pillar_example.first_question: REL 1. How do you manage service quotas and constraints?
reliability_pillar_example.guidance: Use the Info links to understand what answers mean and get more context on the questions

navigation.expand_pillar: Select the expanding icon to the left of the pillar name
navigation.collapse_pillar: Select the collapsing icon on the left of the pillar name
navigation.next_question: Click 'Next' button at bottom of answers
navigation.save_exit: Click 'Save and exit' to pause review

profiles_feature.overview: The Profiles feature allows creation of profiles via pre-defined questions, aligning WAFR with organizational priorities and enabling focused, continuous improvement

benefits.description: Create a profile that reflects current business goals and desired workload outcomes, generating Well-Architected questions specifically prioritized according to immediate objectives
Profile applies to both new and existing workloads, allowing customized review process that accounts for specificities of each application or service
Focus on high-priority areas first, making efficient use of resources by addressing major concerns before moving to less critical questions
Profiles can be shared within team or across organization, promoting alignment and consistency in cloud strategy
Concentrate on questions directly tied to business requirements, better positioned to make informed decisions

steps.action: Choose 'Create a profile'
Answer the profile questionnaire (4 questions)
Save the profile settings

questionnaire.question: What is the current cloud adoption phase for the organization architecting or operating the workloads in this profile?
What is the business value that workloads in this profile represent for your team, organization, or company?
What is the current architectural and operational lifecycle phase of the workloads in this profile?
What are the improvement priorities for Well-Architected Framework Reviews (WAFRs) in this profile?

to_new_workload.description: Option to apply profile is provided as part of creating workload wizard

steps.action: Click on 'Workloads', choose your workload
Scroll down to Profile section and choose 'Add Profile'
Select the profile created in previous section
Click 'Save'

impact.prioritized_questions: AWS Well-Architected Tool places all prioritized questions based on context defined in profile
impact.new_section: A new section appears on top of the existing six Well-Architected framework pillars showing prioritized questions
impact.review_workflow: Begin review by focusing on prioritized questions first, then continue with remaining questions
impact.improvement_plan: Can filter improvement items by prioritized questions and by pillar

steps.action: Navigate to workload with applied profile
Select 'Continue reviewing'
Note the new list of 'Prioritised' questions based on the profile
Answer all prioritized questions first
Use filters in Improvement Plan section to focus on prioritized workload best practices

sharing_profile.description: Profiles can be shared with another IAM user, IAM role, or other AWS accounts in your organization
sharing_profile.purpose: Promote consistency in cloud strategy and bolster collaboration across team members and stakeholders

steps.action: Create a profile share from the Profiles section in console
Provide the AWS account number you intend to share the profile with
Switch to the AWS account that received the share
Navigate to AWS Console → Well-Architected Tool → 'Share invitations'
View the shared profile and click 'Accept'
Review and confirm the invitation details then choose 'Accept'

lenses.overview: Lenses are collections of questions focused on specific technology domains or industries

applying_lens.description: Apply specific lenses to workloads for targeted reviews

custom_lenses.description: Organizations can create custom lenses tailored to their specific needs
custom_lenses.workshop_section: Custom Lenses in the AWS Well-Architected Tool

milestones.concept: Milestones capture the state of a workload at a specific point in time
milestones.purpose: Track progress against high and medium risks over time

saving_milestone.description: Save a milestone after completing a review or making improvements
saving_milestone.use_case: Compare workload state across different time periods to measure improvement

viewing_report.description: View comprehensive report of Well-Architected Review results

review_templates.overview: Review templates facilitate scalable, pre-filled responses for efficient workload best practice assessments

workload_sharing.description: Share workloads with other IAM users, roles, or AWS accounts

aws_cli.overview: Use AWS Command Line Interface (AWS CLI) to access features of the AWS Well-Architected Tool programmatically
aws_cli.purpose: Automate workload creation, reviews, milestones, and report generation
aws_cli.author: Eric Pullen, Senior Solutions Architect
prerequisites: IAM user or federated credentials with WellArchitectedConsoleFullAccess managed policy

workflow_steps.description: Set up AWS CLI and credentials
Use CLI to create workload programmatically
List and apply lenses via CLI
Use AWS SDK for programmatic workload management

aws_sdk.description: Use AWS SDKs (Python, JavaScript, Java, etc.) for programmatic workload management

cloudformation.description: Use custom resources in AWS CloudFormation to create and update Well-Architected Framework Reviews
cloudformation.workshop_section: Using custom resources in AWS CloudFormation to create and update Well-Architected Framework Reviews
use_cases: Automated workload creation with CloudFormation stacks

aws_trusted_advisor.description: Integration with AWS Trusted Advisor for accelerated Well-Architected Framework reviews
aws_trusted_advisor.workshop_section: Integration with AWS Compute Optimizer and AWS Trusted Advisor
benefits: Automated insights from Trusted Advisor checks
Pre-populated answers based on actual AWS resource configuration
aws_trusted_advisor.preview_feature: Accelerating WAFRs using AWS Trusted Advisor

aws_compute_optimizer.description: Integration with AWS Compute Optimizer for performance and cost optimization recommendations
aws_compute_optimizer.workshop_section: Integration with AWS Compute Optimizer and AWS Trusted Advisor

capabilities: Create OpsItems from high and medium risks

custom_reports.overview: Build custom reports of AWS Well-Architected Reviews
custom_reports.workshop_section: Build custom reports of AWS Well-Architected Reviews

review_frequency: Quarterly or semi-annually for ongoing operations
continuous_improvement: Use profiles to focus on business priorities

official_documentation.title: IAM Authentication and Access for Well-Architected Tool

blog_posts.title: Accelerating Well-Architected Framework Reviews using Integrated AWS Trusted Advisor Insights

whitepapers.title: Cloud Adoption Framework - Your Cloud Transformation Journey

workshop_catalog.title: Workshop catalog in AWS Builder Center

pattern_1.name: Automated Workload Creation
pattern_1.description: Automatically create Well-Architected workloads when new application stacks are deployed
pattern_1.implementation: Lambda function triggered by CloudFormation custom resource or EventBridge

pattern_2.name: Scheduled Review Reminders
pattern_2.description: Send reminders to teams to complete or update their Well-Architected reviews
pattern_2.implementation: Lambda function that lists workloads, checks last review date, sends SNS notifications

pattern_3.name: Automated Milestone Creation
pattern_3.description: Automatically create milestones at regular intervals or after deployments
pattern_3.trigger: EventBridge scheduled rule or deployment pipeline
pattern_3.implementation: Lambda function that creates milestones for all workloads

pattern_4.name: Risk Dashboard
pattern_4.description: Build custom dashboard aggregating risks across all workloads
pattern_4.implementation: Lambda function that aggregates data, stores in DynamoDB, displays in QuickSight

pattern_5.name: Compliance Reporting
pattern_5.description: Generate compliance reports showing adherence to organizational standards
pattern_5.implementation: Lambda function that extracts data, generates PDF report, stores in S3

pattern_6.name: Profile-Based Onboarding
pattern_6.description: Apply organization-specific profiles to new workloads automatically
pattern_6.implementation: Lambda function that detects workload type and applies appropriate profile

pattern_7.name: OpsCenter Integration
pattern_7.description: Create OpsCenter OpsItems for high and medium risks
pattern_7.implementation: Lambda function that identifies risks and creates OpsItems

use_cases_for_automation.description: Centrally manage Well-Architected reviews across 100+ workloads in multiple AWS accounts
use_cases_for_automation.automation_value: Programmatically create workloads, apply organizational profiles, generate consolidated reports

use_cases_for_automation.description: Integrate Well-Architected reviews into deployment pipeline
use_cases_for_automation.automation_value: Automatically create workloads when apps are deployed, answer infrastructure-related questions based on IaC templates

use_cases_for_automation.description: Build custom platform that aggregates and tracks risks across all workloads
use_cases_for_automation.automation_value: Create executive dashboards, automated risk reporting, integration with ticketing systems

use_cases_for_automation.description: Service providers conducting WAFRs for multiple clients
use_cases_for_automation.automation_value: Standardized review process, automated report generation, client-specific profiles

use_cases_for_automation.description: Maintain compliance evidence and audit trails
use_cases_for_automation.automation_value: Scheduled reviews, milestone tracking, automated compliance reports

discovery_agent_integration.description: Discovery Agent can use WA Tool API to automatically create workloads
discovery_agent_integration.workflow: After discovering workload details, create workload in WA Tool with pre-filled properties

assessment_agent_integration.description: Assessment Agent can programmatically answer questions based on AWS Config, Security Hub, and Trusted Advisor data
assessment_agent_integration.workflow: For each pillar question, assess current state using AWS service APIs and update answers

validation_agent_integration.description: Validation Agent can verify answers against actual AWS resource configuration
validation_agent_integration.workflow: Cross-check selected choices with AWS Config rules and resource configurations

report_agent_integration.description: Report Agent can generate custom reports using WA Tool data
report_agent_integration.workflow: Extract review data, combine with custom analytics, generate PDF reports

wafr_knowledge_base_mcp.description: MCP server that provides RAG over WAFR documentation and best practices
wafr_knowledge_base_mcp.integration: Can be enhanced with WA Tool API to fetch actual workload data and combine with knowledge base

customer_history_mcp.description: MCP server for benchmarking against past assessments
customer_history_mcp.integration: Use WA Tool API to fetch historical milestone data for comparison

steps.action: Gather workload information via conversation
Create workload in WA Tool using CreateWorkload API
Apply organizational profile using AssociateProfiles API
For each prioritized question, assess and answer using UpdateAnswer API
Verify answers against AWS resource configuration
Create milestone using CreateMilestone API
Generate report using GetLensReviewReport API and custom PDF generation
